ntc2.rftdimensionbuilder.desc3: Once a Dimension has been powered and built, &6it will place down a Matter Receiver&r in the dimension itself&r. You can teleport to it using a Matter Transmitter and Dialing Device, though you have to bring a way back yourself (I suggest a Porter).
ntc2.rftdimensionbuilder.desc4: If the dimension runs out of FE, &cit becomes completely inhospitable&r until powered. &6&lMake sure the Dimension Builder is chunkloaded.&r
ntc2.rftdimshards.subtitle: Mine Dimensional Ore
ntc2.rftdimshards.desc: &bDimensional Shards&r are dropped by Dimensional Ore, which &6only generates in created Dimensions&r.
ntc2.rftdimmon.subtitle: Make a Dimension Modifier
ntc2.rftdimmon.desc: The &bDimension Modifier&r will show you the &6current charge of the dimension you are in&r. This is useful for letting you know if something went horribly wrong at your base, giving you time to leave.
ntc2.rftinfuser.subtitle: Make a Machine Infuser
ntc2.rftinfuser.desc: The &bMachine Infuser&r allows you to &6spend Dimension Shards to improve RFTools machines&r. Hover over a machine to see what its infusing bonus is.
ntc2.rftphasedfield.subtitle: Make a Phased Field Generator
ntc2.rftphasedfield.desc1: The &bPhased Field Generator&r will rapidly use its charge to &6allow you to enter uncharged dimensions&r.
ntc2.rftphasedfield.desc2: It must be in your hotbar to function.
ntc2.rftactivityprobe.subtitle: Make an Activity Probe
ntc2.rftactivityprobe.desc: The &bActivity Probe&r, when placed in a dimension, will stop it from consuming power when no chunks in it are loaded.
ntc2.rftprogrammer.title: If This Then That
ntc2.rftprogrammer.subtitle: Make a Programmer
ntc2.rftprogrammer.desc1: &eRFTools Control&r allows you to &6make programs visually by linking tiles&r. If you've ever used the program Scratch, it's similar to that.
ntc2.rftprogrammer.desc2: On the left of the &bProgrammer&r is a list of tiles, called &6opcodes&r. You drag these to the grid on the right to add them to the program.
ntc2.rftprogrammer.desc3: You can insert a &bProgram Card&r and click &6Save&r to save the program to the card. Load loads from the card, and so on. &3This quest has 2 Program rewards. Load them and read the comments to see how they work.&r
ntc2.rftprogrammer.desc4: Programs are triggered by &6Event&r opcodes. Basically, when a &othing&r happens (depending on the Event), it triggers the connected tile to do something. Some Events are &6Redstone On&r and &6Off&r, &6Repeat&r, etc. Hold shift while hovering over one to see what it does.
ntc2.rftprogrammer.desc5: Opcodes that are not properly configured will have a flashing icon on them. Click it, and you can configure it at the bottom. This Repeat event is set to trigger every second:
ntc2.rftprogrammer.desc6: Double click on a grey blob on a tile's edge to &6aim&r it. When triggered, it will pass the trigger in that direction.
ntc2.rftprogrammer.desc7: &6Operation&r opcodes do something when triggered. These tend to be more complex; see their tooltip for a detailed explanation on each. This program says something in the log every time it is triggered:
ntc2.rftprogrammer.desc8: &6Eval&r opcodes take some sort of input (like a redstone signal strength) and turn it into a text output.
ntc2.rftprogrammer.desc9: &6Test&r opcodes can be aimed in two directions: the &agreen&r path is taken if the test passes; the &cred&r path is taken if it fails.
ntc2.rftprocessor.subtitle: Make a Processor
ntc2.rftprocessor.desc1: The &bProcessor&r is what &6runs programs&r. You need to have a &bCPU&r in order to do anything; higher tiers can do more at a time.
ntc2.rftprocessor.desc2: Insert Program Cards into the top slots and they will start running. The black box under is the &6log&r: any Log Message operation will display here.
ntc2.rftprocessor.desc3: You can also type some commands in the text box under the log. &7help&r will show you all available commands.
ntc2.rftprocessor.desc4: Any opcodes that have a &6side parameter&r will use that side of the Processor; Up will use the top, etc.
ntc2.rftcram.title: Variables
ntc2.rftcram.subtitle: Make some RAM
ntc2.rftcram.desc1: &bRAM&r is required for programs to use &6variables&r. Each RAM Chip adds 8 variables, to a max of 32 to a Processor.
ntc2.rftcram.desc2: Variables are essentially a way to &6store a value to use elsewhere&r. Basically any opcode that takes a value can be pointed at a variable instead.
ntc2.rftcram.desc3: You must &6allocate&r variable slots to Program Cards in the Processor. See the &nResource Allocation&r quest for more details.
ntc2.resourceallocation.title: Resource Allocation
ntc2.resourceallocation.subtitle: Learn how resource allocation works
ntc2.resourceallocation.desc1: Programs that &6use variables&r or &6move items&r must be allocated the specific slots it has available.
ntc2.resourceallocation.desc2: Above the Program Card, click the &bResource Allocation&r button. This allows you to click the inventory slots on the right, or the variable slots on the left, to &6allocate those resources to the program&r, allowing it access to them.
ntc2.resourceallocation.desc3: Here, the program is allocated the top 3 slots of the Processor's inventory:
ntc2.resourceallocation.desc4: This quest gives a program as a reward. This program keeps exactly 10 Cobblestone in an inventory. Load it in a Programmer and read the comments to see how it works.
ntc2.dbstep.title: Debugging: Your Best Friend
ntc2.dbstep.subtitle: Learn about the db command
ntc2.dbstep.desc1: The &bdb&r command (in the Processor, not chat) is the best way to &6figure out why the heck your program isn't working&r.
ntc2.dbstep.desc2: The &7db&r command will allow you to &6debug&r, so you can &6watch your program step by step&r.
ntc2.dbstep.desc3: The &7help&r command will show you all the arguments you can use. &7db debug&r will enable debugging mode for all program slots. You can do &7db debug 0&r to only do the first slot, etc.
ntc2.dbstep.desc4: When in debug mode, your program will wait. &7db step&r (or &7db s&r) will make the program &6go to the next step&r, and it will display which opcode it is on. This allows you to &6follow the path your program is taking&r through your tiles.
ntc2.dbstep.desc5: &7db info&r will also display what tile it is on. &7db last&r will &6display the value&r of the last opcode that handles them.
ntc2.dbstep.desc6: Finally, &7db resume&r will exit debugging mode, resuming normal function.
ntc2.node.title: Avode the Node
ntc2.node.subtitle: Make a Node
ntc2.node.desc1: &bNodes&r can connect to your Processor to &6allow it access to blocks at a distance&r. Instead of needing to be adjacent to the Processor, it can be adjacent to a Node!
ntc2.node.desc2: The Processor needs to have a &bNetwork Card&r installed. The higher tier one allows for a larger range.
ntc2.node.desc3: Type the Processor command &7net setup [name]&r, replacing [name] with the name of your network, which can be anything.
ntc2.node.desc4: Place down a &bNode&r somewhere in range, and set the channel to your network. Give your Node a unique name as well.
ntc2.node.desc5: To connect Nodes to the Processor, run the setup command again. You can do &7net info&r or &7net list&r to confirm that they are connected.
ntc2.node.desc6: In the &6Programmer&r, all Side parameters allow you to input a Node name. Put the name of your Node here, and it will use that instead of the Processor.
ntc2.programkeys.title: Sharing is Caring
ntc2.programkeys.subtitle: Learn how to copy and paste programs
ntc2.programkeys.desc1: In the Programmer, you can &6hold control and tap C&r to &bcopy your program&r as text. Specifically, as the contents of a json file.
ntc2.programkeys.desc2: You can save this text anywhere, like a text file or online somewhere, to share it with others. You can also &bpaste programs&r into the Programmer by &6holding control and tapping V&r.
ntc2.networkid.subtitle: Make a Network Identifier
ntc2.networkid.desc1: The &bNetwork Identifier&r allows you to &6send information between separate networks&r.
ntc2.networkid.desc2: On the destination network (that is, the network that the message is being sent to), sneak right-click a &bNetwork Identifier&r on its Processor.
ntc2.networkid.desc3: Place the linked Identifier &6in the inventory&r of the origin network (that is, the network &osending&r the message). Note, this goes in the &cinventory&r, the slots on the right. It also needs an &bAdvanced Network Card&r.
ntc2.networkid.desc4: In the programmer, use the &6Send Message&r operation. Name is the message name, IdSlot is the inventory slot that has the linked Network Identifier, and Variable is the variable that will be sent in the message. This program goes in the origin network.
ntc2.networkid.desc5: Make a second program, and use the &6Message&r event. This one will start the program when a specific Message is received (set by the Name parameter). Single will make it only run once, when it gets the message.
ntc2.networkid.desc6: When the destination network receives a message, it triggers the Message event, outputting a string that matches the variable the message carries.
ntc2.networkid.desc7: Now, you can't send items between networks, you &ccan only send information&r.
ntc2.controlworkbench.title: Autocrafting
ntc2.controlworkbench.subtitle: Make a Workbench
ntc2.controlworkbench.desc1: The &bWorkbench&r allows you to &6automatically craft items with programs&r.
ntc2.controlworkbench.desc2: Place the Station within range of a Network, and run &7net setup [name]&r again. This will connect the Station to the network.
ntc2.controlworkbench.desc3: Use a &bCrafting Card&r and set up a recipe on the left. If it's a normal crafting recipe, put it in the top left 9 slots and click Update to save the recipe.
ntc2.controlworkbench.desc4: Place this saved Recipe Card in the Workbench, and the network will now know how to craft that item.
ntc2.controlworkbench.desc5: In the Programmer, filter to the category crafting. For &6Get Ingredients&r, &6Inv&r is the inventory to pull ingredient items from, &6CardInv&r is the inventory with the Crafting Cards (ie, the Workbench), &6Item&r is the item to craft.
ntc2.controlworkbench.desc6: For Slot1 and Slot2, set the &6minimum and maximum Processor inv slots&r it can store items in, which should &6match the amount of slots used in the recipe&r. For a 3x3 recipe, Slot2 must be 9 higher Slot1 (so, 0-8 etc). When this is triggered, it will pull the ingredients into the corresponding slots in the Processor.
ntc2.controlworkbench.desc7: Now, use the &6Push Multiple Items&r operation, and set Inv to be the Workbench. Set it to input &6through the top&r, as well. Set Slot1 and Slot2 to the same you did earlier. This will send the items from the Processor to the Workbench, ready to be crafted.
ntc2.controlworkbench.desc8: Use a simple &6Fetch Items&r operation to &6pull from the bottom of the Workbench&r to craft the item. From there, you can do what you want with it.
ntc2.controlcraftstation.title: Easy Autocraft Requesting
ntc2.controlcraftstation.subtitle: Make a Crafting Station
ntc2.controlcraftstation.desc1: The &bCrafting Station&r gives you an easy list of all the craftable items in the network.
ntc2.controlcraftstation.desc2: Make a crafting program like before, but use the event &6Craft&r. This fires off when the craft is requested. You can leave Item blank, but set Inv to the Workbench.
ntc2.controlcraftstation.desc3: In the Get Ingredients operation, set &6Item&r to the Function &6craftresult&r. This will let you use one program to craft any item with a Crafting Card.
ntc2.controlcraftstation.desc4: After fetching the craft result, you can add the &6Mark Craft Ok&r operation, give it the slot the item is in, and it will &6send the item to the Crafting Station&r that requested it!
ntc2.mekheatgen.title: Generates Power &oand&r Heat!
ntc2.mekheatgen.subtitle: Make a Heat Generator
ntc2.mekheatgen.desc1: The &bHeat Generator&r makes FE and heat using one of two modes.
ntc2.mekheatgen.desc2: In &6Active Power&r mode, inserting furnace fuels will burn them into Lava (somehow), and then use it to make FE.
ntc2.mekheatgen.desc3: In &6Passive Power&r mode, placing Lava next to it will generate FE infinitely (though slowly).
ntc2.mekheatgen.desc4: Power can &6only be output through the front&r (the flat side with the green square). Heat can be transferred through any side.
ntc2.metallurgicinfuser.subtitle: Make a Metallurgic Infuser
ntc2.metallurgicinfuser.desc1: The &bMetallurgic Infuser&r allows you to combine two items to create another.
ntc2.metallurgicinfuser.desc2: The secondary material (dusts, usually) go into the far left slot, and have a buffer. The buffer can only store one material at a time.
ntc2.metallurgicinfuser.desc3: Notably, it can be used to create alloys like &6Bronze&r and &6Steel&r. Click the progress arrow to see all recipes.
ntc2.meksolar.subtitle: Make a Solar Generator
ntc2.meksolar.desc: The &bSolar Generator&r generates &617.6 FE/t&r when it can see the sun.
ntc2.meksolar2.subtitle: Make an Advanced Solar Generator
ntc2.meksolar2.desc: The &bAdvanced Solar Generator&r generates &6105.6 FE/t&r when it can see the sun.
ntc2.mekwind.title: Please Don't Just Spam These, I'm Begging You
ntc2.mekwind.subtitle: Make a Wind Generator
ntc2.mekwind.desc: The &bWind Generator&r produces FE based on its elevation. &6At y=200, it generates 384FE/t.&r
ntc2.energycubes.subtitle: Make an Energy Cube
ntc2.energycubes.desc1: &bEnergy Cubes&r come in four tiers, each storing more FE.
ntc2.energycubes.desc2: See their tooltips for how much they store. The lowest stores &6800,000FE&r, and the highest stores &651,200,000FE&r.
ntc2.energycubes.desc3: The top left button in their GUI allows you to set if each side is input or output.
ntc2.inductionmatrix.title: Induction Matrix
ntc2.inductionmatrix.subtitle: Make an Induction Matrix
ntc2.inductionmatrix.desc1: The &bInduction Matrix&r is a multiblock machine that is used to &6store a massive amount of FE&r.
ntc2.inductionmatrix.desc2: The outermost walls must be made out of &bInduction Casing&r, making a rectangular prism that's, at largest, 18x18x18.
ntc2.inductionmatrix.desc3: Replace any of the walls with &bInduction Ports&r, where energy is inserted/extracted.
ntc2.inductionmatrix.desc4: The inside of the multiblock must have at least 1 &bInduction Provider&r and at least 1 &bInduction Cell&r. The only other acceptable block is air.
ntc2.inductionmatrix.desc5: Induction Providers increase the &6amount of FE you are able to insert/extract per tick&r. The more you have (and the higher tier you use), the more FE/t the Matrix as a whole can move. They can be placed anywhere inside.
ntc2.inductionmatrix.desc6: Induction Cells increase the &6amount of FE that is stored in the Matrix&r. The more you have (and the higher tier you use), the more FE is stored. They can be placed anywhere inside.
ntc2.inductionmatrix.desc7: Theoretically, an 18x18x18 Matrix with 1 Provider and 4095 Ultimate Induction Cells could store around &6838,650,000,000,000 FE&r.
ntc2.energizedsmelter.subtitle: Make an Energized Smelter
ntc2.energizedsmelter.desc: The &bEnergized Smelter&r uses FE to smelt items.
ntc2.seismic.title: &bSeismic Vibrator&r
ntc2.seismic.subtitle: Make a Seismic Vibrator and Reader
ntc2.seismic.desc1: The &bSeismic Vibrator&r uses FE to allow the &bSeismic Reader&r to work.
ntc2.seismic.desc2: The Seismic Reader will show all blocks in a 1x1 column beneath the Vibrator, all the way down to Bedrock.
ntc2.mekpump.subtitle: Make an Electric Pump
ntc2.mekpump.desc1: The &bElectric Pump&r uses FE to pump fluids under it, inserting it into the container above. It will pull from all connected source blocks as well.
ntc2.mekpump.desc2: Sources are not replaced with Stone like some mods do, so this &cmight cause lag&r from all the block updates.
ntc2.mekpump.desc3: If pumping Water, it will not remove the source blocks.
ntc2.mekpump.desc4: It can only accept power from the back.
ntc2.chargepad.subtitle: Make a Chargepad
ntc2.chargepad.desc: When FE is piped in through the back, standing on the &bChargepad&r will charge items in your inventory.
ntc2.combiner.title: Technically an Ore Generator
ntc2.combiner.subtitle: Make a Combiner
ntc2.combiner.desc: The &bCombiner&r allows you to combine items to make others, like Dyes and Ores.
ntc2.precsaw.subtitle: Make a Precision Sawmill
ntc2.precsaw.desc1: The &bPrecision Sawmill&r uses FE to process wooden items more efficiently, creating more Planks, Sticks, etc.
ntc2.precsaw.desc2: It is also the one of the &6only sources of Sawdust&r.
ntc2.cardboard.title: &bCardboard Box&r
ntc2.cardboard.subtitle: Make a Cardboard Box
ntc2.cardboard.desc1: The &bCardboard Box&r can be used on any block to seal it, allowing it to be broken, moved, and used again while sneaking to unseal it exactly as it was.
ntc2.cardboard.desc2: This can be used in place of Silk Touch, but also can &6move tile entities&r like chests and spawners!
ntc2.logsorter.title: Kchk
ntc2.logsorter.subtitle: Make a Logistical Sorter
ntc2.logsorter.desc1: The &bLogistical Sorter&r uses filters to &6pull items out of inventories&r and send them out the other side, either into another inventory or pipes (generally Logistical Transporters). When placed, it automatically turns to extract from an adjacent inventory.
ntc2.logsorter.desc3: • &6Itemstack&r: insert an item to set it. You can also set the minimum required and max allowed to be moved at a time, which requires you enable Size Mode using a button. Fuzzy will make it ignore NBT.
ntc2.logsorter.desc4: • &6Tag&r: type in an Ore Dictionary term to accept all that use it. So stuff like "minecraft:wood", "forge:ores", etc. Enabling advanced tooltips and then holding control will show an item's tags.
ntc2.logsorter.desc5: • &6Material&r: insert a placeable block and it will accept all items that are made of the same material. So, putting in wood will allow all wooden items.
ntc2.logsorter.desc6: • &6Mod ID&r: type in a mod id and it will accept all items from that mod.
ntc2.logsorter.desc7: The main screen also has buttons that allow you to toggle between stack/single-item modes, enabling round-robin mode (using Transporters), and if it ignores filters and just moves all items.
ntc2.logsorter.desc8: You can also change the color tag, which is explained in the &6Logistical Transporter&r quest.
ntc2.nutliq.subtitle: Make some Nutritional Paste
ntc2.nutliq.desc1: &6Nutritional Paste&r is an edible fluid that is made in the &bNutritional Liquifier&r, using any food item.
ntc2.nutliq.desc2: The more the food would have filled you, the more Paste it makes.
ntc2.nutliq.desc3: Paste is stored in the &bCanteen&r. Using it will &6eat however much Paste it takes to fill you entirely&r.
ntc2.nutliq.desc4: The Canteen can hold the equivalent of 160 cooked Steaks.
ntc2.osmcomp.title: ᴼˢᵐᶦᵘᵐ
ntc2.osmcomp.subtitle: Make an Osmium Compressor
ntc2.osmcomp.desc1: The &bOsmium Compressor&r is used to &6infuse Osmium into Obsidian or Glowstone&r.
ntc2.osmcomp.desc2: To provide Osmium, simply insert the item in the bottom slot. Then, place the ingredient item in the top.
ntc2.basicfactories.title: Parallel Production
ntc2.basicfactories.subtitle: Make any Basic Factory
ntc2.basicfactories.desc1: &bBasic Factories&r exist for most Mekanism machines, and function identically.
ntc2.basicfactories.desc2: However, each Basic Factory has &63 inputs and outputs&r, allowing it work three stacks at once.
ntc2.basicfactories.desc3: You can also enable &6Auto-sort&r, which will automatically split the input slots equally.
ntc2.advfactories.subtitle: Make any Advanced Factory
ntc2.elitefactories.subtitle: Make any Elite Factory
ntc2.ultimatefactories.subtitle: Make any Ultimate Factory
ntc2.formass.title: &bFormulaic Assemblicator&r
ntc2.formass.subtitle: Make a Formulaic Assemblicator
ntc2.formass.desc1: The &bFormulaic Assemblicator&r allows you to automatically craft a single recipe using items piped into it.
ntc2.formass.desc2: At the top, set the recipe. Then you can either set it to craft for as long as it has items in the slots, or craft only once.
ntc2.formass.desc3: In order to craft infinitely using the storage slots, you have to insert a &bCrafting Formula&r and click the &6Encode Formula&r button.
ntc2.formass.desc4: After that, you can click &6Auto-Mode&r to make it craft infinitely from its storage.
ntc2.mekx2.title: Ore Doubling
ntc2.mekx2.subtitle: Learn about Mekanism's ore processing
ntc2.mekx2.desc1: Mekanism is unique among most mods in that it can process ores to get &6more than 2 times the normal amount of ingots&r.
ntc2.mekx2.desc2: These quests will walk you through each step of the processing. To begin with, the quest below allows ore doubling.
ntc2.enrichcenter.title: &bEnrichment Chamber&r
ntc2.enrichcenter.subtitle: Make an Enrichment Chamber
ntc2.enrichcenter.desc1: The &bEnrichment Chamber&r enriches items, cleaning them, compressing them, or extracting from them.
ntc2.enrichcenter.desc2: This can be used to convert 1 ore into 2 dusts, as well as compress secondary materials for optimum use in the Metallurgic Infuser.
ntc2.prc.title: PRC
ntc2.prc.subtitle: Make a Pressurized Reaction Chamber
ntc2.prc.desc1: The &bPressurized Reaction Chamber&r is used to combine a &6gas&r, &6fluid&r, and &6item&r to create something, usually &6Substrate&r or &6Ethylene&r.
ntc2.prc.desc2: Items, energy, fluids, and gases can only be &6inserted into specific sides&r, remember. You can change these in the GUI; it has tabs for each.
ntc2.gasburn.subtitle: Make a Gas-Burning Generator
ntc2.gasburn.desc1: The &bGas-Burning Generator&r generates a decent amount of FE by burning certain gasses. Not nearly as OP as in other packs, but still good.
ntc2.gasburn.desc2: A really good setup for this would be to &6grow Melon in a Garden Cloche&r, mash it into &6Bio Fuel&r, convert it to Substrate and Ethylene in the PRC, and then &6burn the Ethylene&r. This can run several Gas-Burning Generators in tandem.
ntc2.gasburn.desc3: Note: you will &6have to change the input/output sides&r in some of these.
ntc2.mekx3.title: Ore Tripling
ntc2.mekx3.subtitle: Learn how to triple ores
ntc2.mekx3.desc: These quests will show how to &6triple&r your ore output.
ntc2.electrosep.subtitle: Make an Electrolytic Separator
ntc2.electrosep.desc1: The &bElectrolytic Separator&r takes one fluid and splits it into two &6gases&r (which are &c&nnot fluids&r! See the Pressurized Tubes quest).
ntc2.electrosep.desc2: For &6ore tripling&r, you need to split Water into Hydrogen and &6Oxygen&r.
ntc2.electrosep.desc3: For &6ore quadrupling&r, you need to split Brine into &6Chlorine&r and Sodium, as well as the &6Hydrogen&r from earlier.
ntc2.purification.title: &bPurification Chamber&r
ntc2.purification.subtitle: Make a Purification Chamber
ntc2.purification.desc1: The &bPurification Chamber&r uses Oxygen to &6convert ores into 3 ore Clumps&r.
ntc2.purification.desc2: Oddly enough, you can use Flint as a source of Oxygen. JEI will show all item->gas recipes.
ntc2.mekcrusher.subtitle: Make a Crusher
ntc2.mekcrusher.desc2: In this case, you can crush Clumps into Dirty Dust, which you can then enrich and smelt into ingots.
ntc2.mekx4.title: Ore Quadrupling
ntc2.mekx4.subtitle: Learn how to quadruple ores
ntc2.mekx4.desc: These quests will show you how to &6quadruple&r your ore output.
ntc2.thermevap.title: Thermal Evaporation Plant
ntc2.thermevap.subtitle: Make a Thermal Evaporation Plant
ntc2.thermevap.desc1: The &bThermal Evaporation Plant&r is a multiblock machine that &6converts Water into Brine&r.
ntc2.thermevap.desc2: Place a 4x4 platform of &bThermal Evaporation Blocks&r, and then build up the outer blocks by at least 2 layers using more TEBs, a &bThermal Evaporation Controller&r, and two &bThermal Evaporation Valves&r which have to be on the top layer.
ntc2.thermevap.desc3: The minimum height is 2 blocks tall, but it can be increased up to 18 blocks tall to store more. You do not need corners in the top layer.
ntc2.thermevap.desc4: The speed it works at is based on the temperature. You can connect &6Thermodynamic Conductors&r to the Valves.
ntc2.cheminfuse.subtitle: Make a Chemical Infuser
ntc2.cheminfuse.desc1: The &bChemical Infuser&r combines/reacts two gases to create another.
ntc2.cheminfuse.desc2: For ore quadrupling, you &6need Hydrogen Chloride, by combining Hydrogen and Chlorine&r (which you get from Brine).
ntc2.cheminject.subtitle: Make a Chemical Injection Chamber
ntc2.cheminject.desc: The &bChemical Injection Chamber&r combines Hydrogen Chloride with ore to make &64 shards&r, which can each be purified into 1 Clump.
ntc2.mekx5.title: Ore Quintupling
ntc2.mekx5.subtitle: Learn how to quintuple ores
ntc2.mekx5.desc: These quests will show you how to &6quintuple&r your ore output.
ntc2.chemoxid.subtitle: Make a Chemical Oxidizer
ntc2.chemoxid.desc1: The &bChemical Oxidizer&r allows you to turn certain items into gases.
ntc2.chemoxid.desc2: For the purposes of ore quintupling, you need to &6convert Sulfur to Sulfur Dioxide&r, which has to be combined with Oxygen in the Chemical Infuser to make &6Sulfer Trioxide&r.
ntc2.rotarycondens.subtitle: Make a Rotary Condensator
ntc2.rotarycondens.desc1: The &bRotary Condensator&r allows you to convert between the gas and fluid forms of certain chemicals.
ntc2.rotarycondens.desc2: For the purposes of ore quintupling, you need to &6decondensentrate Water into Water Vapor&r, which has to be combined with Sulfur Trioxide in the Chemical Infuser to create &6Sulfuric Acid&r.
ntc2.chemdiss.subtitle: Make a Chemical Dissolution Chamber
ntc2.chemdiss.desc: The &bChemical Dissolution Chamber&r allows you to combine ores with Sulfuric Acid to create a bucket of &6ore slurry&r.
ntc2.chemwasher.subtitle: Make a Chemical Washer
ntc2.chemwasher.desc: The &bChemical Washer&r combines 5mB of Water with 1mB of ore Slurry to create 1mB of &6Clean ore Slurry&r.
ntc2.chemcryst.subtitle: Make a Chemical Crystallizer
ntc2.chemcryst.desc1: The &bChemical Crystallizer&r converts 200mB of Clean ore Slurry into an ore Crystal, which can be converted to a Shard, then Clump, then Dirty Dust, then Dust, then Ingot.
ntc2.chemcryst.desc2: Recall that each ore is 1000mB, so you get &65 ingots total&r.
ntc2.atomicdiss.title: Atomic Striker
ntc2.atomicdiss.subtitle: Make an Atomic Disassembler
ntc2.atomicdiss.desc1: The &bAtomic Disassembler&r works as a Pickaxe, Axe, Shovel, Hoe, and Scoop. It uses FE instead of durability, and cannot be enchanted.
ntc2.atomicdiss.desc2: It has 6 modes. Swap between modes with the &6Change Item Mode&r key (default is period).
ntc2.atomicdiss.desc3: • &6Normal&r: As fast as a Diamond tool with Efficiency II. Hoes a 3x3 area.
ntc2.atomicdiss.desc4: • &6Slow&r: As fast as a Diamond tool. Hoes a single block.
ntc2.atomicdiss.desc5: • &6Fast&r: As fast as a Diamond tool with Efficiency V. Hoes a 5x5 area.
ntc2.atomicdiss.desc6: • &6Vein&r: Mines all connected blocks of the same type, though it ignores Stone and other "normal" blocks.
ntc2.atomicdiss.desc7: • &6Extended Vein Mining&r: Same as Vein, except it works on everything.
ntc2.atomicdiss.desc8: • &6Off&r: Can't dig or hoe, but still deals damage.
ntc2.robit.title: The &bRobit&r
ntc2.robit.subtitle: Make a Robit
ntc2.robit.desc1: The &bRobit&r is your friendly mechanical companion, pet, and ally!
ntc2.robit.desc2: Place it down on a &6Chargepad&r to charge it. It will also teleport there when it runs out of power.
ntc2.robit.desc3: When charged, right-click on it to open its GUI. There, you can toggle &6follow mode&r, teleport it back to its chargepad, toggle if it &6picks up items&r, and set its name.
ntc2.robit.desc4: It also has a 3x3 crafting grid, 27 storage slots, a Furnace, and an Anvil. Move between these pages with the buttons on the right.
ntc2.robit.desc5: Use a Configurator on it while sneaking to pick it up.
ntc2.mekportal.title: The &bTeleporter&r
ntc2.mekportal.subtitle: Make a Teleporter
ntc2.mekportal.desc1: The &bTeleporter&r is a multiblock that allows you to teleport between Teleporters on the same frequency.
ntc2.mekportal.desc2: Place a Teleporter block, and make a hollow 4x3 of &bTeleporter Frames&r with the Teleporter centered on the bottom.
ntc2.mekportal.desc3: They can be placed in &6any orientation&r; they can be horizontal, sideways, etc.
ntc2.mekportal.desc4: Open the Teleporter block's GUI, optionally switch to Private mode if you only want yourself to be able to use it, and enter a name into the "Set" textbox to &6create a frequency&r.
ntc2.mekportal.desc5: At other Teleporters, &6choose that frequency out of the list&r and click "Set."
ntc2.mekportal.desc6: They really &6only work normally in pairs&r. If you add more, the additional ones all go to the first Teleporter. Entering the first Teleporter will always send you to the second Teleporter.
ntc2.portableteleport.title: Porta-Port (PP)
ntc2.portableteleport.subtitle: Make a Portable Teleporter
ntc2.portableteleport.desc: The &bPortable Teleporter&r, when used, will allow you to pick a teleporter frequency, and then teleports you to the nearest Teleporter on it.
ntc2.digitalminer.subtitle: Make a Digital Miner
ntc2.digitalminer.desc1: The &bDigital Miner&r will search an area (default radius 10 blocks, max 32), scan it according to filters, and then mine those blocks and store their drops.
ntc2.digitalminer.desc2: Click &6Config&r to set the filters, the radius, the minimum and maximum y levels it checks, and Inverse mode (making filters act as a blacklist).
ntc2.digitalminer.desc3: Once your filters are set (I recommend a Tag filter for "forge:ores"), click &6Start&r and let it run.
ntc2.digitalminer.desc4: There are several more buttons on the main menu:
ntc2.digitalminer.desc5: • &6Reset&r, which resets the block-mining position and allows you to change filters again.
ntc2.digitalminer.desc6: • &6Auto-eject&r, which makes it automatically push items out the back.
ntc2.digitalminer.desc7: • &6Silk touch&r, which applies a Silk Touch enchantment at the cost of additional FE.
ntc2.digitalminer.desc8: • &6Auto-pull&r, which will replace mined blocks with a block from the inventory above itself.
ntc2.digitalminer.desc9: You can also install upgrades in the top-right button menu.
ntc2.quantumentangle.title: The &bQuantum Entangloporter&r
ntc2.quantumentangle.subtitle: Make a Quantum Entangloporter - Which is kinda like a Tesseract
ntc2.quantumentangle.desc1: The &bQuantum Entangloporter&r can be set a channel, and then will transport FE, fluids, gases, and items to other Entangloporters on the same channel.
ntc2.quantumentangle.desc2: You have to set the input/output sides in the &6Side Config&r button menu.
ntc2.mekspeed.subtitle: Make a Speed Upgrade
ntc2.mekspeed.desc1: Up to 8 &bSpeed Upgrades&r can be installed to most Mekanism machines, making them work faster at the cost of more power.
ntc2.mekspeed.desc2: Fully upgraded, a machine is &610x faster&r but uses &610x the FE&r.
ntc2.mekspeed.desc3: Be warned: if you install so many Speed Upgrades that it &6requires more energy than can be stored&r, it &6won't work at all&r. You can fix this by installing Energy Upgrades.
ntc2.mekenergy.subtitle: Make an Energy Upgrade
ntc2.mekenergy.desc1: Up to 8 &bEnergy Upgrades&r can be installed to most Mekanism machines, making them use less and store more energy.
ntc2.mekenergy.desc2: Fully upgraded, a machine &6uses 10x less&r and &6stores 10x more FE&r.
ntc2.mekgas.subtitle: Make a Gas Upgrade
ntc2.mekgas.desc: Up to 8 &bGas Upgrades&r can be installed to machines that use gas, lowering the amount they used.
ntc2.mekmuffling.subtitle: Make a Muffling Upgrade
ntc2.mekmuffling.desc: Up to 4 &bMuffling Upgrades&r can be installed to most Mekanism machines, making them less loud.
ntc2.freerunners.title: Advanced Knee Replacement
ntc2.freerunners.subtitle: Make Free Runners
ntc2.freerunners.desc1: &bFree Runners&r, when charged and worn as boots, will allow you to &6walk up single blocks&r and &6negates all fall damage&r.
ntc2.freerunners.desc2: However, it has no armor and thus gives no protection from attack damage.
ntc2.freerunners.desc3: It only uses up charge when negating fall damage; higher falls drain more power.
ntc2.mekscuba.title: Atadashi
ntc2.mekscuba.subtitle: Make a Scuba Mask and Tank
ntc2.mekscuba.desc1: The &bScuba Tank&r holds Oxygen gas, allowing you to &6breathe underwater&r while wearing the &bScuba Mask&r.
ntc2.mekscuba.desc2: You have to manually turn the Scuba Tank on and off using the &6Chest Mode Switch key&r (see Controls). If on, the Scuba Tank will use up Oxygen even if you are above water.
ntc2.mekflamethrower.title: Fueled up! Ready to fry!
ntc2.mekflamethrower.subtitle: Make a Flamethrower
ntc2.mekflamethrower.desc1: The &bFlamethrower&r uses Hydrogen gas as fuel to shoot a stream of fire. The behavior of this stream depends on its mode:
ntc2.mekflamethrower.desc2: In &6Combat&r mode, it will damage mobs and set them on fire. It will also destroy drops, but will not light blocks on fire.
ntc2.mekflamethrower.desc3: In &6Heat&r mode, it still damages mobs but will smelt blocks and items.
ntc2.mekflamethrower.desc4: In &6Inferno&r mode, it will light blocks it touches on fire.
ntc2.mekflamethrower.desc5: To swap between modes, hold shift and hit the &6Item Mode Switch&r key (see controls).
ntc2.mekelecbow.subtitle: Make an Electric Bow
ntc2.mekelecbow.desc1: The &bElectric Bow&r is simply a regular Bow that uses FE instead of durability. It cannot be enchanted.
ntc2.mekelecbow.desc2: However, the &6Item Mode Switch&r key (see controls) can enable &6Fire Mode&r, which uses more FE to light arrows on fire.
ntc2.mekjetpack1.subtitle: Make a Jetpack
ntc2.mekjetpack1.desc1: The &bJetpack&r uses Hydrogen gas as fuel to allow you to fly upwards while holding jump.
ntc2.mekjetpack1.desc2: It has three modes, which you can switch between using the &6Armor Mode Switch key&r (see Controls).
ntc2.mekjetpack1.desc3: In &6Regular&r mode, holding space will make you rise, and releasing will make you fall.
ntc2.mekjetpack1.desc4: In &6Hover&r mode, holding space will make you rise, and releasing will allow you to hover at that height (at a constant cost of Hydrogen). Sneaking will lower you down.
ntc2.mekjetpack1.desc5: In &6Disabled&r mode, it does nothing other than look cool.
ntc2.mekjetpack2.subtitle: Make an Armored Jetpack
ntc2.mekjetpack2.desc: The &bArmored Jetpack&r works identically to the Jetpack, except it gives &6slightly more protection than a Diamond Chestplate with Protection IV&r.
ntc2.universalcables.subtitle: Make Universal Cables
ntc2.universalcables.desc1: &bUniversal Cables&r are used to transfer FE.
ntc2.universalcables.desc2: There are 4 tiers of Universal Cable, each moving and storing more than the last.
ntc2.universalcables.desc3: You can upgrade Cables by clicking them (in tier order) with &6Enriched Alloy&r, &6Reinforced Alloy&r, and &6Atomic Alloy&r. This will upgrade up to 8 connected Cables at once.
ntc2.logisticaltransporter.title: Logistics Pipes™
ntc2.logisticaltransporter.subtitle: Make Logistical Transporters
ntc2.logisticaltransporter.desc1: &bLogistical Transporters&r are Mekanism's item pipes. Each tier moves items faster.
ntc2.logisticaltransporter.desc2: Sneak clicking a connection with a &6Configurator&r allows you to move between &6normal&r, &6push&r, &6pull&r, and &6none&r modes.
ntc2.logisticaltransporter.desc3: Items will try to go through the shortest possible path, &6prioritizing nearby destinations&r over farther away ones.
ntc2.logisticaltransporter.desc4: Sneak clicking the center of a pulling Logistical Transporter with a Configurator will change their color, &6painting items they extract&r, only allowing them to go through other painted &6Transporters of the same color&r.
ntc2.logisticaltransporter.desc5: You can upgrade Transporters by clicking them (in tier order) with &6Enriched Alloy&r, &6Reinforced Alloy&r, and &6Atomic Alloy&r. This will upgrade up to 8 connected Cables at once.
ntc2.mekspecialtransporters.title: Dense/Vacuum Itemducts
ntc2.mekspecialtransporters.subtitle: Make a Restrictive/Diversion Transporter
ntc2.mekspecialtransporters.desc1: The &bRestrictive Transporter&r is &6only used if there are no other available destinations&r.
ntc2.mekspecialtransporters.desc2: The &bDiversion Transporter&r &6stops transfer through with a redstone signal&r.
ntc2.mechanicalpipes.title: Better Than PVC
ntc2.mechanicalpipes.subtitle: Make Mechanical Pipes
ntc2.mechanicalpipes.desc2: Sneak clicking a connection with a &6Configurator&r allows you to move between &6normal&r, &6push&r, &6pull&r, and &6none&r modes.
ntc2.mechanicalpipes.desc3: You can upgrade Pipes by clicking them (in tier order) with &6Enriched Alloy&r, &6Reinforced Alloy&r, and &6Atomic Alloy&r. This will upgrade up to 8 connected Cables at once.
ntc2.pressurizedtube.title: A Series of Tubes
ntc2.pressurizedtube.subtitle: Make Pressurized Tubes
ntc2.pressurizedtube.desc1: &bPressurized Tubes&r move gases. Higher tiers can move and store more.
ntc2.pressurizedtube.desc2: Sneak clicking a connection with a &6Configurator&r allows you to move between &6normal&r, &6push&r, &6pull&r, and &6none&r modes.
ntc2.pressurizedtube.desc3: You can upgrade Tubes by clicking them (in tier order) with &6Enriched Alloy&r, &6Reinforced Alloy&r, and &6Atomic Alloy&r. This will upgrade up to 8 connected Cables at once.
ntc2.thermoconduct.title: Thermo Dynamics
ntc2.thermoconduct.subtitle: Make Thermodynamic Conductors
ntc2.thermoconduct.desc1: &bThermodynamic Conductors&r can transfer heat energy. Transfer is lossy, with colder biomes losing more heat per block.
ntc2.thermoconduct.desc2: Sneak clicking a connection with a &6Configurator&r allows you to move between &6normal&r, &6push&r, &6pull&r, and &6none&r modes.
ntc2.thermoconduct.desc3: You can upgrade Conductors by clicking them (in tier order) with &6Enriched Alloy&r, &6Reinforced Alloy&r, and &6Atomic Alloy&r. This will upgrade up to 8 connected Cables at once.
ntc2.isocent.subtitle: Make the Isotopic Centrifuge
ntc2.isocent.desc1: The &bIsotopic Centrifuge&r is used to &6make Fissile Fuel&r, which powers the Fission Reactor.
ntc2.isocent.desc2: It can also make Plutonium, which is used for some end-game items.
ntc2.mekfission.title: Big Reactor
ntc2.mekfission.subtitle: Construct a Fission Reactor
ntc2.mekfission.desc1: The &bFission Reactor&r is a multiblock that &6generates a massive amount of heat&r, as well as some other byproducts. &cRead the entire next three quests before starting it.&r The Fission Reactor is &lincredibly&r dangerous, you may want to test in a creative world as well.
ntc2.mekfission.desc2: The multiblock can be any cuboid from 3x4x3 to 18x18x18. Try to match this image:
ntc2.mekfission.desc3: The edges must be &bFission Reactor Casings&r, but the walls can be &bReactor Glass&r.
ntc2.mekfission.desc4: From the bottom, place a pillar of &bFission Fuel Assemblies&r, topped with a &bControl Rod Assembly&r. If you have room, you can place multiple Assembly towers, but they &cmust not touch&r aside from corners.
ntc2.mekfission.desc5: Assembly towers do not have to reach the top. The Control Rod Assembly must go &cunder the top Casings&r, not flush with them.
ntc2.mekfission.desc6: The walls must also have 4 &bFission Reactor Ports&r; one for coolant input, heat output (as either Water Vapor or Superheated Sodium, or Thermodynamic Conductors), Fissile Fuel input, and Nuclear Waste output. Configure which it is with the Configurator.
ntc2.fisslogic.title: Circuit Breaker
ntc2.fisslogic.subtitle: Make a Fission Reactor Logic Adapter
ntc2.fisslogic.desc1: The &bFission Reactor Logic Adapter&r allows you to &6control your Reactor with redstone&r.
ntc2.fisslogic.desc2: You can set it to either &6toggle the Reactor&r based on an RS signal, or &6emit a signal if the Reactor is in danger&r.
ntc2.fisslogic.desc3: There are 4 "danger detectors": High Temperature, Excess Waste, Damage Critical, and Insufficient Fuel. Open its GUI to choose what it does.
ntc2.fisslogic.desc4: A circuit like this will disable the Reactor if &oanything&r goes wrong. The bottom 4 are for each danger, and the top turns the Reactor on.
ntc2.fisslogic.desc5: If any of the dangers are present, it disables the Reactor until it is safe again, and then turns it back on.
ntc2.fisslogic.desc6: One danger that this doesn't stop is &csudden loss of coolant&r at high burn rate. In that event, the Reactor may massively overheat before it has time to turn off.
ntc2.fisslogic.desc7: To fix this, you can use the signal to &6send emergency backup coolant&r.
ntc2.mekfission2.title: Splitting the Atom
ntc2.mekfission2.subtitle: Learn how to use the Fission Reactor
ntc2.mekfission2.desc1: In one of the input Ports, provide &6Fissile Fuel&r. In the other, provide a coolant (either Water, or Sodium gas).
ntc2.mekfission2.desc2: Sodium burns much faster and at lower temperature, but requires you use a &6Thermoelectric Boiler&r to heat Water into Steam. This produces more Steam faster than using Water coolant does, but requires that extra step.
ntc2.mekfission2.desc3: In the GUI, open the Stats. The &6Burn Rate&r is how fast it uses Fuel. The faster it burns, the faster it heats. It is recommended to &6start it low&r, and raise it as your coolant production allows.
ntc2.mekfission2.desc4: The &6Heating Rate&r is how fast coolant gets heated. Sodium gets heated 10x faster than Water. Basically, this amount is how fast you have to make and insert coolant.
ntc2.mekfission2.desc5: One very important thing to watch out for is &6Temperature&r. If your Reactor reaches &61200K&r or hotter, it will &cstart to take damage&r.
ntc2.mekfission2.desc6: If your &6Damage&r gets too high (a bit over 150%%), it will &ccreate a huge explosion and irradiate a 5 chunk radius&r around itself. So, obviously, very bad.
ntc2.mekfission2.desc7:
Some tips to prevent problems:
• Keep your Reactor in one chunk, and your Coolant chunkloaded.
• Keep your Burn Rate low until you're confident you can handle higher.
• Keep your reactor somewhere you don't mind exploding, like a Compact Machine or under your friend's house.
ntc2.radiation.subtitle: Learn about radiation
ntc2.radiation.desc1: &cRadiation&r can leak into the environment if certain things happen:
ntc2.radiation.desc2:
• Reactor meltdown
• Reactor running while full of Waste
• Breaking any block containing radioactive materials
ntc2.radiation.desc3:
These materials are radioactive:
• Nuclear Waste (obviously)
• Polonium Pellets
• Plutonium Pellets
• Spent Nuclear Waste
ntc2.radiation.desc4: Radioactive Waste is a gas that can be stored in &bRadioactive Waste Barrels&r. In fact, that's the &oonly&r place they can be stored. &6Shift-right click one&r to see how full it is.
ntc2.radiation.desc5: Waste Barrels will &6delete Waste at 1mB per minute&r. As such, it's best to make a lot them. Environmental radiation also dissippates over time, but &cover a much longer period&r (50 in-game days). You &ccannot safely move them&r by any means.
ntc2.radiation.desc6: Radiation is not a fun thing to have. It will &cstarve and damage you&r, and has a &cvery wide range&r around the source. See the quests above for ways to protect yourself.
ntc2.mekhaz.title: The &bHazmat suit&r
ntc2.mekhaz.subtitle: Make a Hazmat suit
ntc2.mekhaz.desc1: The &bHazmat suit&r will &6insulate you from environmental radiation&r when worn.
ntc2.mekhaz.desc2: The more you wear, the more protected you are. Frankly, it isn't even worth wearing only some of it without the rest.
ntc2.mekhaz.desc3: Note, you are &cnot fully protected&r, just mostly.
ntc2.radmeasure.title: Rads dude
ntc2.radmeasure.subtitle: Make the Geiger Counter and Dosimeter
ntc2.radmeasure.desc1: When used, the &bGeiger Counter&r will &6tell you your current Radiation Exposure&r where you are. Normal, safe background levels are aroung 100 nSv/h, &mwhatever those are&r.
ntc2.radmeasure.desc2: The &bDosimeter&r will &6tell you your current Radiation Dose&r. Basically, how irradiated you yourself are.
ntc2.radmeasure.desc3: Obviously, higher numbers are worse. Green is safe, yellow is unsafe, orange is dangerous, and red is critical.
ntc2.wasteuses.title: Nuculer dummy, the S is silent
ntc2.wasteuses.subtitle: Use Nuclear Waste to make something
ntc2.wasteuses.desc1: These items are made using Nuclear Waste in some way.
ntc2.wasteuses.desc2: This will create &6Spent Nuclear Waste&r as a byproduct, which &oactually&r has no uses. You just have to store it and let it dissipate.
ntc2.meklaser.title: Shoop Da Whoop
ntc2.meklaser.subtitle: Make a Laser
ntc2.meklaser.desc1: The &bLaser&r uses FE to shoot out a beam from its front end.
ntc2.meklaser.desc2: The Laser beam will damage any mob it touches, lighting them on fire. It will also mine blocks.
ntc2.laseramplifier.title: &lLaser&r
ntc2.laseramplifier.subtitle: Make a Laser Amplifier
ntc2.laseramplifier.desc1: The &bLaser Amplifier&r can accept Laser beams from 5 of its sides, store their energy, then shoot it out the front.
ntc2.laseramplifier.desc2: In its GUI, you can set the &6minimum FE required&r to fire, as well as the &6maximum amount it can fire at once&r.
ntc2.laseramplifier.desc3: You can also set a &6Delay&r in ticks. The laser will emit for a short pulse, then wait the time set by the delay, then repeat.
ntc2.laseramplifier.desc4: The bottom left, you can change the &6Redstone Output&r mode. &6Energy Contents&r will allow a Comparator to output the amount of energy it has, and &6Entity Detection&r will make it emit a signal when the laser is touching an entity.
ntc2.laseramplifier.desc5: The bottom right lets you make it only emit the laser beam based on the &6redstone signal it receives&r.
ntc2.laseramplifier.desc6: If the Amplifier is &6not emitting&r the laser, other laser inputs are directly converted to stored FE. You can &6extract&r this with a Universal Cable configured to Pull. Other mods' cables will not work.
ntc2.lasertract.subtitle: Make a Laser Tractor Beam
ntc2.lasertract.desc1: The &bLaser Tractor Beam&r accepts Laser Beams from its 5 outer sides, then shoots it out the front.
ntc2.lasertract.desc2: It will &6pick up drops&r from blocks mined and mobs killed.
ntc2.solneut.title: The &bSolar Neutron Activator&r
ntc2.solneut.subtitle: Make a Solar Neutron Activator
ntc2.solneut.desc: The &bSolar Neutron Activator&r uses solar energy to &6convert one gas into another&r.
ntc2.mekreactor.title: The &bFusion Reactor&r
ntc2.mekreactor.subtitle: Construct a Fusion Reactor
ntc2.mekreactor.desc1: The &bFusion Reactor&r is a rather complex multiblock, capable of generating extremely high amounts of FE.
ntc2.mekreactor.desc2: Try to replicate this design. Basically, a 5x5 cube of &bFusion Reactor Frames&r with the corners dug out.
ntc2.mekreactor.desc3: The center of one side must be a &bLaser Focus Matrix&r, and the other have to be &bFusion Reactor Ports&r. The top center must be the &bFusion Reactor Controller&r. Any Frames that aren't edges can be replaced with &6Reactor Glass&r.
ntc2.mekreactor2.title: This Quest is All Reading
ntc2.mekreactor2.subtitle: Learn how to run the Fusion Reactor
ntc2.mekreactor2.desc1: The Fusion Reactor is powered by &6Deuterium&r and &6Tritium&r, as well as an unreasonable amount of Laser-power to jumpstart it.
ntc2.mekreactor2.desc2: Pump in these two gases via Reactor Ports.
ntc2.mekreactor2.desc3: Before being jumpstarted, a &bHohlraum&r full of &6D-T Fuel&r must be inserted into the slot in the Reactor Controller.
ntc2.mekreactor2.desc4: In the &6Fuel&r tab of the Reactor Controller, set the &6injection rate&r. This is the combined amount in mB/t of the fuel to be spent. So setting it at 2 would spend 1mB/t of each fuel.
ntc2.mekreactor2.desc5: Higher injection rates mean higher temperatures, more FE production, and also more resource cost.
ntc2.mekreactor2.desc6: To begin, the Reactor must reach a certain temperature (see &6Statistics&r page in its GUI).
ntc2.mekreactor2.desc7: To reach this temperature, shoot it with a high-powered laser. It's best to do it all at once instead of spreading it out. The Laser Amplifier should have about &6&n600,000,000 FE&r in it before you turn it on, though &6up to 8 million&r may be required.
ntc2.mekreactor2.desc8: The resulting reaction, assuming the injection rate is high enough, will &6keep itself hot and running&r.
ntc2.mekreactor2.desc9: At the bottom left, you can see the current amount of FE being generated. &6FE can be extracted from a Reactor Port.&r
ntc2.mekreactor2.desc10: For reference, an injection rate of 50 generates &650,000,000 FE/t&r.
ntc2.mekreactorbackup.title: Just in Case
ntc2.mekreactorbackup.subtitle: Make an emergency energy backup
ntc2.mekreactorbackup.desc1: As the previous quest stated, it costs upwards of &6600 million FE&r to jumpstart a Reactor. That's a lot of FE.
ntc2.mekreactorbackup.desc2: As such, you should make an &bemergency energy backup&r that doesn't power anything but the Lasers, &6just in case the Reactor turns itself off without you noticing&r, and your storage gets drained.
ntc2.dtfuel.title: &bD-T Fuel&r
ntc2.dtfuel.subtitle: Learn about D-T Fuel
ntc2.dtfuel.desc1: &bD-T Fuel&r can also be piped into the Fusion Reactor, but it's a bit more complex.
ntc2.dtfuel.desc2: Normally, you can restrict the amount of Deuterium and Tritium used by changing the injection rate.
ntc2.dtfuel.desc3: However, as D-T Fuel is already mixed and thus doesn't need to be injected, &6it gets used up as fast as possible&r. This is great if you have a huge source of D-T Fuel, but generally that's not the case.
ntc2.meksteam.title: Steam Powered
ntc2.meksteam.subtitle: Water-cool the Reactor
ntc2.meksteam.desc1: With the addition of two more Reactor Ports, you can pipe in Water and pipe out &bSteam&r.
ntc2.meksteam.desc2: Steam can be used in the &rIndustrial Turbine&r, which can generate even more FE in parallel with the Reactor.
ntc2.thermoelectric.title: Thermoelectric Boiler
ntc2.thermoelectric.subtitle: Construct a Thermoelectric Boiler
ntc2.thermoelectric.desc1: The &bThermoelectric Boiler&r is a multiblock that &6uses heat to make Steam&r.
ntc2.thermoelectric.desc2: It can be any cuboid within a 3x3x3 to 18x18x18 area. Its frame must be made out of &bBoiler Casings&r, and the walls can be made of either Casings or &6Structural Glass&r.
ntc2.thermoelectric.desc3: On the bottom, place a layer of &bSuperheating Elements&r. It doesn't have to fill the entire space, but it has to be centered. You can place additional layers on top, to make it heat faster.
ntc2.thermoelectric.desc4: Some layers above the Elements, place a layer of &bPressure Dispersers&r. These &odo&r have to span the entire layer.
ntc2.thermoelectric.desc5: The more empty air blocks below the Dispersers, the more liquid Water it can store. The more blocks above, the more Steam it can store.
ntc2.thermoelectric.desc6: In the walls below the Dispersers, place two &bBoiler Valves&r: one for heat input (via &6Thermodynamic Conductors&r, or &6Superheated Sodium&r). Above the Dispersers, place another Valve for &6Steam output&r. Use a &6Configurator&r to set each one.
ntc2.thermoelectric.desc7: Once this is all done, your Boiler is ready to use. If you're using Superheated Sodium, you will need a third Valve under the Dispersers for coolant output.
ntc2.mekturbine.title: The &bIndustrial Turbine&r
ntc2.mekturbine.subtitle: Make an Industrial Turbine
ntc2.mekturbine.desc1: The &bIndustrial Turbine&r is a &oreally&r complex multiblock that uses Steam to generate FE. This quest will explain how to make it.
ntc2.mekturbine.desc2: Its bottom must be an odd-length square of at least 5x5, and its height must be at least twice that minus one, and at most 18.
ntc2.mekturbine.desc3: The frame must be made of &bTurbine Casing&r, but the walls can be be made of &6Structural Glass&r if preferred.
ntc2.mekturbine.desc4: Starting from the center bottom, place a pillar of &bTurbine Rotors&r. It cannot reach the top, as explained below.
ntc2.mekturbine.desc5: Attach 2 &bTurbine Blades&r to each Rotor. The more you place, the wider they get; &cdo not let them touch the sides&r.
ntc2.mekturbine.desc6: Directly &6on top of the highest Rotor&r, place a &bRotational Complex&r. Fill that entire layer wall-to-wall with &bPressure Dispersers&r. Fill the layer above with &bElectromagnetic Coils&r.
ntc2.mekturbine.desc7: Place &bTurbine Vents&r in the walls above the Complex. The more Vents, the higher the flow rate, and the more FE/t it makes.
ntc2.mekturbine.desc8: Place a &bTurbine Vent&r in one of the walls, &6at or above the layer that the Pressure Dispersers are on&r. The more Vents, the higher the flow rate, and thus higher energy production.
ntc2.mekturbine2.title: Now That &oThat's&r Out of the Way
ntc2.mekturbine2.subtitle: Learn how to run an Industrial Turbine
ntc2.mekturbine2.desc1: Now that your Turbine is constructed, you can &blearn how to actually &ouse&r&b the darn thing&r.
ntc2.mekturbine2.desc2: &6The higher the flow rate, the higher the FE produced.&r
ntc2.mekturbine2.desc3: The flow rate is based on either the volume of the lower portion of the Turbine or the amount of vents; &6whichever is less&r.
ntc2.mekturbine2.desc4: In the &6Turbine Statistics&r page of its GUI, you can see what the &6limiting factors&r are. That is, what's stopping it from making more FE/t.
ntc2.mekturbine2.desc5: These limiting factors are relative. To produce more FE, increase the amount of whatever is a limiting factor (install more Vents or Blades etc).
ntc2.mekturbine2.desc6: The final FE production is equal to the &6flow multiplied by the Rotor height, multiplied again by 50, then divided by 7&r. All these values are in the Turbine's GUI.
ntc2.mektanks.title: Portable Tanks
ntc2.mektanks.subtitle: Make a Fluid Tank
ntc2.mektanks.desc1: &bFluid Tanks&r are single-block fluid containers. Each tier stores more than the last.
ntc2.mektanks.desc2: You can mine a Fluid Tank and it will &6keep its contents&r.
ntc2.mektanks.desc3: They can also be &6used as Buckets&r.
ntc2.gastank.title: &bChemical Tanks&r
ntc2.gastank.subtitle: Make a Chemical Tank
ntc2.gastank.desc: &bChemical Tanks&r store gas. Each tier stores more.
ntc2.configurator.title: The &bConfigurator&r
ntc2.configurator.subtitle: Make a Configurator
ntc2.configurator.desc1: The &bConfigurator&r is Mekanism's wrench, using FE to configure blocks.
ntc2.configurator.desc2: Hovering over a Mekanism machine will show the &6color&r of that side (see the quest directly to the left).
ntc2.configurator.desc3: Right-clicking the Configurator on a machine will say in chat its &6current color&r, as well as what it means.
ntc2.configurator.desc4: Sneak right-clicking will &6cycle through all possible colors&r on that face.
ntc2.configurator.desc5: There is also special interactions when clicked on pipes:
ntc2.configurator.desc6: Right-clicking the center of a pipe will toggle its &6redstone sensitivity&r.
ntc2.configurator.desc7: Sneak right-clicking a connection will toggle it between &6neutral&r, &6push&r, &6pull&r, and &6none&r.
ntc2.mekcolors.title: The Configurator
ntc2.mekcolors.subtitle: Learn about Mekanism's color modes
ntc2.mekcolors.desc1: The Configurator color codes the input/output of each side of a machine, when held. These colors are:
ntc2.mekcolors.desc3: &4Dark Red&r: input for items and gasses.
ntc2.mekcolors.desc4: &1Dark Blue&r: output for items and gasses.
ntc2.mekcolors.desc6: &dPurple&r: input for secondary material for the Metallurgic Infuser
ntc2.mekcolors.desc7: &eYellow&r: neutral for fluids, must be pushed/pulled in the pipe
ntc2.mekbin.title: Bins
ntc2.mekbin.subtitle: Make a Bin
ntc2.mekbin.desc1: &bBins&r can store a large amount of a single item, sort of like a Drawer.
ntc2.mekbin.desc2: Actually, exactly like a Drawer. Right-click to insert, punch to extract, the whole shebang.
ntc2.mekbin.desc3: However, if you put one by itself in a crafting grid, you can pull its items out.
ntc2.dynamictank.subtitle: Make a Dynamic Tank
ntc2.dynamictank.desc1: &bDynamic Tanks&r are freeform multiblock fluid/chemical containers.
ntc2.dynamictank.desc2: Make any hollow cuboid out of Dynamic Tank blocks.
ntc2.dynamictank.desc3: You can replace any non-corner with &bStructural Glass&r to be able to see how much fluid is inside.
ntc2.dynamictank.desc4: Place &bDynamic Valves&r in any surface, aside from the edges, to automatically input and extract fluids.
ntc2.dynamictank.desc5: Every block in its volume (including the walls) gives it &616 buckets&r of fluid it can store.
ntc2.sps.title: Supercritical Phase Shifter
ntc2.sps.subtitle: Construct the SPS
ntc2.sps.desc1: The &bSupercritical Phase Shifter&r is a multiblock that uses a large amount of FE to &6convert Polonium gas into Antimatter gas&r.
ntc2.sps.desc2: Try to match the image below:
ntc2.sps.desc3: Any of the &bGlass&r can be a &bPort&r instead. Ports with &bSupercharged Coils&r will take FE, the more you have the faster it works.
ntc2.sps.desc4: Use a Configurator on a Port to toggle between input and output. When the SPS has FE and Polonium, it will convert to Antimatter.
ntc2.antipellet.subtitle: Make an Antimatter Pellet
ntc2.antipellet.desc: You can use the &6Chemical Crystallizer&r to turn Antimatter gas into &bAntimatter Pellets&r. These are used in some recipes.
ntc2.antisynth.title: Anti Pro Tonic Nuc Leo Synth Es Iz Er
ntc2.antisynth.subtitle: Make an Antiprotonic Nucleosynthesizer
ntc2.antisynth.desc: The &bAntiprotonic Nucleosynthesizer&r uses Antimatter gas to make certain precious materials.
ntc2.qio.title: AE2 But No Wires
ntc2.qio.subtitle: Make a QUI setup
ntc2.qio.desc1: &bQIO&r, which stands for "Quantum Item Orchestration," is a &6mass storage system&r that can be accessed from anywhere and requires no power..
ntc2.qio.desc2: Place a &bQUI Drive Array&r anywhere in the world, and &6set its frequency&r so you can connect it to other parts.
ntc2.qio.desc3: To make a frequency, type it in the text box and click the checkmark button. To choose an existing frequency, click it from the list and click &6Set&r.
ntc2.qio.desc4: Place some &bQIO Drives&r in the Array. This is where items will be stored. Each can handle up to 8,192 unique items, and higher tiers can store higher total amounts.
ntc2.qio.desc5: Access the Drives using a &bQUI Dashboard&r. Place it anywhere and connect it to the frequency, and then you can insert and extract items as you like.
ntc2.qioio.title: QIO IO
ntc2.qioio.subtitle: Make the QUI Importer and Exporter
ntc2.qioio.desc1: The &bQUI Importer&r can be placed on an inventory and will &6pull items from it into its network&r.
ntc2.qioio.desc2: Likewise, the &bQUI Exporter&r will &6push items from its system&r into the inventory it is on.
ntc2.qioio.desc3: Both can be given whitelists, and can be set to work without.
ntc2.qioadapt.title: Technically Autocrafting?
ntc2.qioadapt.subtitle: Make a QUI Redstone Adapter
ntc2.qioadapt.desc1: The &bQUI Redstone Adapter&r can be configured to &6emite a redstone signal when you have above a set amount of a set item&r.
ntc2.qioadapt.desc2: Insert the item in the top left slot, then type the amount next to the &2>&r to set the amount.
ntc2.qioadapt.desc3: There's no way to make it work when &obelow&r an amount, other than inverting its signal with a redstone torch.
ntc2.mekasuit.title: The &bMekaSuit&r
ntc2.mekasuit.subtitle: Make a full MekaSuit
ntc2.mekasuit.desc1: The &bMekaSuit&r is a highly &6upgradable&r late-game armor set.
ntc2.mekasuit.desc2: When worn, it will add a bar above your health that &6shows the armor's charge level&r. The helmet will also give more HUD elements, like a compass.
ntc2.mekasuit.desc3: Use the Module Tweaker key (\ by default), to edit the armor and any modules it has installed.
ntc2.mekasuit.desc4: As a further plus, it &6looks dang cool&r.
ntc2.mekamods.title: &bModification Station&r
ntc2.mekamods.subtitle: Make a Modification Station
ntc2.mekamods.desc1: You can install &bMod Units&r in the &bModification Station&r.
ntc2.mekamods.desc2: Place the item to upgrade in the right slot, and the module Unit in the left.
ntc2.mekamods.desc3: I highly recommend reading the descriptions of each Module. Pretty much all of them are useful in some way, but there's too many to describe here.
ntc2.mekatool.subtitle: Make the Meka-Tool
ntc2.mekatool.desc1: The &bMeka-Tool&r is an all-in-one mining tool and weapon.
ntc2.mekatool.desc2: It's rather weak by default, but is fairly impressive when upgraded. Make sure to use the Module Tweaker key (\ by default) to actually make use of these modules.
ntc2.be.amberlands.title: Amber Lands
ntc2.be.amberlands.subtitle: Amber Lands is a forest of twisting trees and tall vegetation. You can mine amber ore here.
ntc2.be.amberlands.desc3:
Plants: 
Amber Grass
Bulb Moss
Glowing Pillar
Orange Charnia
Red Charnia
Lanceleaf
ntc2.be.blossomingspires.title: Blossoming Spires
ntc2.be.blossomingspires.subtitle: Blossoming Spires are islands and floating spires covered in lush pink and blue foliage and colorful hanging plants. Petals gently fall from above. Silk moth nests can be found here.
ntc2.be.blossomingspires.desc3:
Plants: 
Bulb Vine
Bushy Grass
Twisted Moss
Blossom Berry
